clinical_study.brief_title: Intravesical BCG Administration to Patients With Invasive Bladder Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Local and Regional Immune Responses to Intravesical BCG Administration to Patients With Invasive Bladder Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with invasive bladder cancer will be given 3-6 treatments (based on treatment response) BCG intravesically followed by a cystectomy.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients with muscle invasive (≥T1) bladder cancer will be given 3-6 treatments (based on treatment response) intravesical TICE® BCG. BCG is an attenuated, live culture preparation of the Bacillus of Calmette and Guerin (BCG) strain of Mycobacterium bovis.
After completion of BCG treatments the patient will undergo a cystectomy. A portion of bladder tumor tissue and lymph nodes will be collected for research purposes during the cystectomy.

primary_outcome.measure: Ability of BCG to enhance tumor specific immunity
primary_outcome.time_frame: At cystectomy at 3-6 weeks after BCG treatment

arm_group.description: Invasive bladder cancer treated with 3-6 weeks of intravesical BCG

intervention.description: Invasive bladder cancer treated with 3-6 weeks of intravesical BCG

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Have suspected or known invasive (≥T1) bladder cancer
2. Be able to give informed consent
3. Be age 18 or older
4. Not be in an immunosuppressed state (e.g. HIV+, use of chronic steroids >1 month)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Have non-invasive (<T1) bladder cancer
2. Unable to give informed consent
3. < 18 or older
4. Is in an immunosuppressed state (e.g. HIV+, use of chronic steroids >1 month)
